entry.title: A Not-So-Thorough Overview of Database Indexes

link.title: A Not-So-Thorough Overview of Database Indexes

entry.summary: What’s an index? In simple terms, database indexes are data structures which allow for efficient reading. You can imagine them as lookup tables which store pointers (in most cases) to the location of the searched row in the table. Scaler: SQL Server Clustered Indexes Hence, if you execute the following query: SELECT * FROM users WHERE user_id = 123456 The database engine will look into...
